text: Ralph Theodore Joseph Branca (January 6, 1926 - November 23, 2016) was an American baseball player. He was a former starting pitcher in Major League Baseball. From 1944 through 1956, Branca played for the Brooklyn Dodgers (1944–53, 1956), Detroit Tigers (1953–54), and New York Yankees (1954). Branca died on the morning of November 23, 2016 at a nursing home in Rye Brook, New York, aged 90. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Baseball Library * The Top 5 Reasons You Can't Blame Ralph Branca (ESPN Classic) * Joshua Prager's The Echoing Green Category:1926 births Category:2016 deaths Category:American baseball players Category:Brooklyn Dodgers players Category:Detroit Tigers players Category:New York Yankees players Category:Sportspeople from New York (state) Category:People from Mount Vernon, New York
title: Ralph Branca
